CVE-2024-13709
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-25T06:30:31

1 posts

The Linear plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'linear-debug'. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset the plugin's cache via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-25T07:43:52.000Z ##

CVE-2024-13709 – WordPress Linear CSRF Weakness

CVE ID : CVE-2024-13709 Published : Jan. 25, 2025, 4:15 a.m. | 2 hours, 13 minutes ago Description : The Linear plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'linear-debug'. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset the plugin's cache via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-13709-wordpress-linear-csrf-weakness/5028/

CVE-2025-0411
(7.0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-25T06:30:24

9 posts

7-Zip Mark-of-the-Web Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-of-the-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of 7-Zip. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the handling of archived files. When extracting files from a

2 repos

https://github.com/dhmosfunk/7-Zip-CVE-2025-0411-POC

https://github.com/CastroJared/7-Zip-CVE-2025-0411-POC

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-25T07:43:53.000Z ##

CVE-2025-0411 – 7-Zip Mark-of-the-Web Bypass RCE Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-0411 Published : Jan. 25, 2025, 5:15 a.m. | 1 hour, 13 minutes ago Description : 7-Zip Mark-of-the-Web Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-of-the-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of 7-Zip. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the handling of archived files. When extracting […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-0411-7-zip-mark-of-the-web-bypass-rce-vulnerability/5029/

##
DarkWebInformer at 2025-01-22T21:57:44.508Z ##

🚨CVE-2025-0411: 7-Zip Mark-of-the-Web Bypass Vulnerability

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2025-0411-7-zip-mark-of-the-web-bypass-vulnerability/

##
avoidthehack at 2025-01-22T16:45:01.158Z ##

7-Zip fixes bug that bypasses #Windows MoTW #security warnings, patch now

Tracked as CVE-2025-0411.

If a user downloads a crafted archive with the Mark of the Web, 7-zip doesn’t extend the MoTW to the extracted files. This can be exploited to execute arbitrary code.

Was fixed on 30 NOV 24. However, 7-zip doesn’t auto update, so users should double check their installed versions.

#cve #security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/7-zip-fixes-bug-that-bypasses-the-windows-motw-security-mechanism-patch-now/

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2025-01-22T10:40:02.000Z ##

Cette faille de sécurité dans 7-Zip permet de contourner la sécurité MotW de Windows https://www.it-connect.fr/faille-7-zip-contourner-securite-motw-de-windows-cve-2025-0411/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Windows #7-ZIP

##
maniabel@mastodon.de at 2025-01-21T19:15:32.000Z ##

7zip braucht auch ein wenig Update-Liebe: CVE-2025-0411 ermöglicht entfernten Angreifern die Umgehung des Mark-of-the-Web-Schutzmechanismus in betroffenen Installationen von 7-Zip. Um diese Sicherheitsanfälligkeit auszunutzen, ist eine Benutzerinteraktion erforderlich, da das Ziel eine bösartige Seite besuchen oder eine bösartige Datei öffnen muss.
Und weil 7zip keine eigene UpdateInstallationsRoutine besitzt, müssen Nutzende das Update - mindestens 24.09 selbst installieren: https://7-zip.org/
DASSimBLICK #APPS #7zip #FOSS

##

CVE-2025-0357
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-25T03:31:49

1 posts

The WPBookit plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to insufficient file type validation in the 'WPB_Profile_controller::handle_image_upload' function in versions up to, and including, 1.6.9. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server which may make remote code execution possible.

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server which may make remote code execution possible. Severity: 9.8 | […]

##

CVE-2025-0708
(3.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2025-01-24T21:31:34

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in fumiao opencms 2.2. It has been declared as problematic. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /admin/model/addOrUpdate of the component Add Model Management Page. The manipulation of the argument 模板前缀 leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

##

CVE-2024-38821
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-24T21:31:28

2 posts

Spring WebFlux applications that have Spring Security authorization rules on static resources can be bypassed under certain circumstances. For this to impact an application, all of the following must be true: * It must be a WebFlux application * It must be using Spring's static resources support * It must have a non-permitAll authorization rule applied to the static resources support

2 repos

https://github.com/masa42/CVE-2024-38821-POC

https://github.com/mouadk/cve-2024-38821

cR0w at 2025-01-23T13:31:51.226Z ##

Remember this perfect 10 in Apache MINA?

https://lists.apache.org/thread/4wxktgjpggdbto15d515wdctohb0qmv8

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52046

Apparently #MOVEit Gateway was impacted by it.

Also, it sounds like MOVEit Automation was impacted by October's sev:CRIT in Spring WebFlux.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38821

##

CVE-2024-12857
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-24T21:31:28

1 posts

The AdForest theme for WordPress is vulnerable to authentication bypass in all versions up to, and including, 5.1.8. This is due to the plugin not properly verifying a user's identity prior to logging them in as that user. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to authenticate as any user as long as they have configured OTP login by phone number.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-22T16:30:07.000Z ##

CVE-2024-12857 – AdForest WordPress Authentication Bypass Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2024-12857 Published : Jan. 22, 2025, 7:15 a.m. | 9 hours, 14 minutes ago Description : The AdForest theme for WordPress is vulnerable to authentication bypass in all versions up to, and including, 5.1.8. This is due to the plugin not properly verifying a user's identity prior to logging them in as that user. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to authenticate as any user as long as they have configured OTP login by phone number. Severity: 9.8 | […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-12857-adforest-wordpress-authentication-bypass-vulnerability/4708/

CVE-2019-15690
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-24T18:31:23

1 posts

LibVNCServer 0.9.12 release and earlier contains heap buffer overflow vulnerability within the HandleCursorShape() function in libvncclient/cursor.c. An attacker sends cursor shapes with specially crafted dimensions, which can result in remote code execution.

An attacker sends cursor shapes with specially crafted dimensions, which can result in remote code execution. Severity: 8.8 | HIGH Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and more... Go to […]

CVE-2025-23222
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-24T18:31:23

1 posts

An issue was discovered in Deepin dde-api-proxy through 1.0.19 in which unprivileged users can access D-Bus services as root. Specifically, dde-api-proxy runs as root and forwards messages from arbitrary local users to legacy D-Bus methods in the actual D-Bus services, and the actual D-Bus services don't know about the proxy situation (they believe that root is asking them to do things). Consequen

Specifically, dde-api-proxy runs as root and forwards messages from arbitrary local users to legacy D-Bus methods in the actual D-Bus services, and the actual D-Bus services don't know about the proxy situation (they believe that root is asking them to do […]

CVE-2024-40693
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-24T18:31:22

1 posts

IBM Planning Analytics 2.0 and 2.1 could be vulnerable to malicious file upload by not validating the content of the file uploaded to the web interface. Attackers can make use of this weakness and upload malicious executable files into the system, and it can be sent to victim for performing further attacks.

CVE-2025-0314
(8.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-24T03:30:40

2 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 17.2 before 17.6.4, 17.7 before 17.7.3, and 17.8 before 17.8.1. Improper rendering of certain file types lead to cross-site scripting.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T16:29:49.095Z ##

GitLab had one #PatchTuesday yes, how about second Patch Tuesday (on a Wednesday)? #PatchEveryday continues: GitLab Patch Release: 17.8.1, 17.7.3, 17.6.4

  • CVE-2025-0314 (8.7 high) Stored XSS via Asciidoctor render
  • CVE-2024-11931 (6.4 medium) Developer could exfiltrate protected CI/CD variables via CI lint
  • CVE-2024-6324 (4.3 medium) Cyclic reference of epics leads resource exhaustion

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

  • CVE-2024-11931 (6.4 medium) Developer could exfiltrate protected CI/CD variables via CI lint

CVE-2025-0693
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-24T00:31:57

1 posts

Variable response times in the AWS Sign-in IAM user login flow allowed for the use of brute force enumeration techniques to identify valid IAM usernames in an arbitrary AWS account.

awssecurityfeed at 2025-01-23T23:43:42.108Z ##

Issue with AWS Sign-in IAM User Login Flow – Possible Username Enumeration (CVE-2025-0693)

Publication Date: 2025/01/23 1:30 PM PDT
We have identified CVE-2025-0693 in the AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS IAM) Sign-in login flow. This issue could allow an actor to enumerate AWS IAM usernames by measuring server response times during login attempts...

https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2025-002/

#aws #security

CVE-2025-23089
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-24T00:31:46

3 posts

This CVE has been issued to inform users that they are using End-of-Life (EOL) versions of Node.js. These versions are no longer supported and do not receive updates, including security patches. The continued use of EOL versions may expose systems to potential security risks due to unaddressed software vulnerabilities or dependencies (CWE-1104: Use of Unmaintained Third-Party Components). Users a

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-22T16:30:06.000Z ##

These versions are no longer supported and do not receive updates, including security patches. The continued use of EOL versions may expose systems to potential security risks due to unaddressed software vulnerabilities or dependencies (CWE-1104: Use of Unmaintained Third-Party […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-23089-microsoft-node-js-unmaintained-component-exposure-vulnerability/4706/

##
adulau at 2025-01-22T09:36:12.989Z ##

Interesting approach to CVE allocation: announcing End-of-Life (EOL) versions of Node.js. I haven't notice this practice before.

Not entirely sure about the objective. Does this mean the Node.js team plans to restrict CVE creation for older, unmaintained versions of Node.js?

#nodejs #cve #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity

🔗 https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/cve-2025-23089

CVE ID : CVE-2025-23088 Published : Jan. 22, 2025, 2:15 a.m. | 14 hours, 14 minutes ago Description : This CVE has been issued to inform users that they are using End-of-Life (EOL) versions of Node.js. These versions are no longer supported and do not receive updates, including security patches. The continued use of EOL versions may expose systems to potential security risks due to unaddressed software vulnerabilities or dependencies (CWE-1104: Use of Unmaintained Third-Party […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-23088-node-js-unmaintained-third-party-components-vulnerability-cwe-1104/4705/

##

CVE-2025-23087
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-24T00:31:46

1 posts

This CVE has been issued to inform users that they are using End-of-Life (EOL) versions of Node.js. These versions are no longer supported and do not receive updates, including security patches. The continued use of EOL versions may expose systems to potential security risks due to unaddressed software vulnerabilities or dependencies (CWE-1104: Use of Unmaintained Third-Party Components). Users a

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-22T16:30:04.000Z ##

CVE-2025-23087 – Node.js End-of-Life Vulnerability: Unmaintained Version Use

CVE ID : CVE-2025-23087 Published : Jan. 22, 2025, 2:15 a.m. | 14 hours, 14 minutes ago Description : This CVE has been issued to inform users that they are using End-of-Life (EOL) versions of Node.js. These versions are no longer supported and do not receive updates, including security patches. The continued use of EOL versions may expose systems to potential security risks due to unaddressed software vulnerabilities or dependencies (CWE-1104: Use of Unmaintained Third-Party […]

##

CVE-2020-11023
(6.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 38.15%

updated 2025-01-23T23:24:10

8 posts

### Impact Passing HTML containing `<option>` elements from untrusted sources - even after sanitizing them - to one of jQuery's DOM manipulation methods (i.e. `.html()`, `.append()`, and others) may execute untrusted code. ### Patches This problem is patched in jQuery 3.5.0. ### Workarounds To workaround this issue without upgrading, use [DOMPurify](https://github.com/cure53/DOMPurify) with its

5 repos

https://github.com/Cybernegro/CVE-2020-11023

https://github.com/DanielRuf/snyk-js-jquery-565129

https://github.com/andreassundstrom/cve-2020-11023-demonstration

https://github.com/Snorlyd/https-nj.gov---CVE-2020-11023

https://github.com/0xAJ2K/CVE-2020-11022-CVE-2020-11023

screaminggoat at 2025-01-24T14:39:18.531Z ##

Security Week: CISA Warns of Old jQuery Vulnerability Linked to Chinese APT
CISA added CVE-2020-11023 (6.9 medium) JQuery Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability to the KEV Catalog yesterday. According to Security Week, exploitation of CVE-2020-11023 was noted by Tenable back in 2021. Digging further, exploitation evidence came from cybersecurity company "Cyber SecurityWorks" (now known as Securin) who explicitly wrote CVE-2020-11023 "exploited by APT1 APT group". Interestingly CSW identified CVE-2020-11023 as an Oracle vulnerability, which is likely a product downstream.

APT1 is attributed to the People's Liberation Army (PLA) Unit 61398. In 2014, the U.S. Government charged five Chinese military hackers in connection to APT1 activity. No idea if APT1 still exists in its current form or if it's been merged into PLA's Cyber Space Force. cc: @ekovacs

#cisa #china #apt1 #cyberespionage #CVE_2020_11023 #pla #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
AAKL at 2025-01-23T17:29:35.099Z ##

CISA has a KEV catalogue update:

- CVE-2020-11023: JQuery Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2020-11023

Also:

- CISA Releases Six Industrial Control Systems Advisories https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/23/cisa-releases-six-industrial-control-systems-advisories @cisagov #cybersecurity #infosec #CISA

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-24T14:39:18.000Z ##

Security Week: CISA Warns of Old jQuery Vulnerability Linked to Chinese APT
CISA added CVE-2020-11023 (6.9 medium) JQuery Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability to the KEV Catalog yesterday. According to Security Week, exploitation of CVE-2020-11023 was noted by Tenable back in 2021. Digging further, exploitation evidence came from cybersecurity company "Cyber SecurityWorks" (now known as Securin) who explicitly wrote CVE-2020-11023 "exploited by APT1 APT group". Interestingly CSW identified CVE-2020-11023 as an Oracle vulnerability, which is likely a product downstream.

APT1 is attributed to the People's Liberation Army (PLA) Unit 61398. In 2014, the U.S. Government charged five Chinese military hackers in connection to APT1 activity. No idea if APT1 still exists in its current form or if it's been merged into PLA's Cyber Space Force. cc: @ekovacs

CVE-2024-52325
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T18:31:26

2 posts

ECOVACS robot lawnmowers and vacuums are vulnerable to command injection via SetNetPin() over an unauthenticated BLE connection.

##

CVE-2025-0395
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T18:15:32.983000

2 posts

When the assert() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.13 to 2.40 fails, it does not allocate enough space for the assertion failure message string and size information, which may lead to a buffer overflow if the message string size aligns to page size.

andersonc0d3 at 2025-01-22T13:49:40.052Z ##

CVE-2025-0395: Buffer overflow in the GNU C Library's assert()

https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2025/q1/48

##
andersonc0d3@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T13:49:40.000Z ##

CVE-2025-0395: Buffer overflow in the GNU C Library's assert()

https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2025/q1/48

##

CVE-2025-24397
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T17:15:27.643000

2 posts

An incorrect permission check in Jenkins GitLab Plugin 1.9.6 and earlier allows attackers with global Item/Configure permission (while lacking Item/Configure permission on any particular job) to enumerate credential IDs of GitLab API token and Secret text credentials stored in Jenkins.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.681Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.000Z ##

updated 2025-01-23T16:15:41.333000

A missing permission check in Jenkins Azure Service Fabric Plugin 1.6 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to enumerate credentials IDs of Azure credentials stored in Jenkins.

##

CVE-2025-24401
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T16:15:41.050000

2 posts

Jenkins Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin 217.vd5b_18537403e and earlier does not verify that permissions configured to be granted are enabled, potentially allowing users formerly granted (typically optional permissions, like Overall/Manage) to access functionality they're no longer entitled to.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.681Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

##

CVE-2025-23006
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.18%

updated 2025-01-23T15:32:07

28 posts

Pre-authentication deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability has been identified in the SMA1000 Appliance Management Console (AMC) and Central Management Console (CMC), which in specific conditions could potentially enable a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands.

AAKL at 2025-01-24T19:14:41.939Z ##

CIA has updated the KEV catalogue.

CVE-2025-23006: SonicWall SMA1000 Appliances Deserialization Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-23006 @cisacyber #cybersecurity #SonicWall #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-23T12:16:30.904Z ##

SonicWall exploited zero-day: SMA1000 Pre-Authentication Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
CVE-2025-23006 (9.8 critical) Pre-authentication deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability has been identified in the SMA1000 Appliance Management Console (AMC) and Central Management Console (CMC), which in specific conditions could potentially enable a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands.

IMPORTANT: SonicWall PSIRT has been notified of possible active exploitation of the referenced vulnerability by threat actors

cc: @goatyell @cR0w @GossiTheDog @briankrebs

#zeroday #CVE_2025_23006 #sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation

ClubTeleMatique@mstdn.social at 2025-01-23T22:15:43.000Z ##

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-23T16:28:21.000Z ##

SonicWall advisory, from yesterday. Take action if you haven't already:
SMA1000 Pre-Authentication Remote Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2025-23006 https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2025-0002 @sonicwallalerts

More: SonicWall Urges Immediate Patch for Critical CVE-2025-23006 Flaw Amid Likely Exploitation https://thehackernews.com/2025/01/sonicwall-urges-immediate-patch-for.html @thehackernews #cybersecurity #infosec #SonicWall

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-23T13:49:49.000Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-23006, is rated 9.8 out of a maximum of 10.0 on the CVSS scoring system. https://thehackernews.com/2025/01/sonicwall-urges-immediate-patch-for.html

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-23T12:16:30.000Z ##

SonicWall exploited zero-day: SMA1000 Pre-Authentication Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
CVE-2025-23006 (9.8 critical) Pre-authentication deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability has been identified in the SMA1000 Appliance Management Console (AMC) and Central Management Console (CMC), which in specific conditions could potentially enable a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands.

IMPORTANT: SonicWall PSIRT has been notified of possible active exploitation of the referenced vulnerability by threat actors

cc: @goatyell @cR0w @GossiTheDog @briankrebs

#zeroday #CVE_2025_23006 #sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation

SonicWall SMA appliances exploited in zero-day attacks (CVE-2025-23006) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2025/01/23/sonicwall-sma-1000-exploited-zero-day-cve-2025-23006/ #securityupdate #secureaccess #enterprise #Don'tmiss #Microsoft #SonicWall #Hotstuff #0-day #News

##

CVE-2025-24400
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T15:15:13.570000

2 posts

Jenkins Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin 2.8.0 through 2.10.2 (both inclusive) uses the credential ID as the cache key during signing operations, allowing attackers able to create a credential with the same ID as a legitimate one in a different credentials store to sign an event published to RabbitMQ with the legitimate credentials.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.681Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2025-24399
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T15:15:13.440000

2 posts

Jenkins OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.452.v2849b_d3945fa_ and earlier, except 4.438.440.v3f5f201de5dc, treats usernames as case-insensitive, allowing attackers on Jenkins instances configured with a case-sensitive OpenID Connect provider to log in as any user by providing a username that differs only in letter case, potentially gaining administrator access to Jenkins.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.681Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

##

CVE-2024-43708
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T12:32:36

2 posts

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling in Kibana can lead to a crash caused by a specially crafted payload to a number of inputs in Kibana UI. This can be carried out by users with read access to any feature in Kibana.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-23T13:50:41.305Z ##

#PatchEveryday continues for @NosirrahSec as Elastic releases yet another security update: Kibana 7.17.23/8.15.0 Security Updates (ESA-2024-32, ESA-2024-33)
CVE-2024-52972 (6.5 medium) and CVE-2024-43708 (6.5 medium) Kibana allocation of resources without limits or throttling leads to crash

No mention of exploitation.

#elastic #kibana #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-52975
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T09:31:18

2 posts

An issue was identified in Fleet Server where Fleet policies that could contain sensitive information were logged on INFO and ERROR log levels. The nature of the sensitive information largely depends on the integrations enabled.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T16:02:58.680Z ##

You've heard of #PatchTuesday, now get ready for PatchEveryday: Elastic security advisories 22 January 2025:

  • Fleet Server 8.15.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-31) CVE-2024-52975 (8.0 high) Fleet Server sensitive information exposure via logs
  • Kibana 8.15.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-29, ESA-2024-30) CVE-2024-43710 (4.3 medium) Kibana server-side request forgery

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-52972
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T09:31:17

2 posts

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling in Kibana can lead to a crash caused by a specially crafted request to /api/metrics/snapshot. This can be carried out by users with read access to the Observability Metrics or Logs features in Kibana.

##

CVE-2024-43710
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-23T06:31:54

2 posts

A server side request forgery vulnerability was identified in Kibana where the /api/fleet/health_check API could be used to send requests to internal endpoints. Due to the nature of the underlying request, only endpoints available over https that return JSON could be accessed. This can be carried out by users with read access to Fleet.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T16:02:58.680Z ##

You've heard of #PatchTuesday, now get ready for PatchEveryday: Elastic security advisories 22 January 2025:

  • Fleet Server 8.15.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-31) CVE-2024-52975 (8.0 high) Fleet Server sensitive information exposure via logs
  • Kibana 8.15.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-29, ESA-2024-30) CVE-2024-43710 (4.3 medium) Kibana server-side request forgery

No mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-55591
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.63%

updated 2025-01-23T02:00:02.310000

35 posts

An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS version 7.0.0 through 7.0.16 and FortiProxy version 7.0.0 through 7.0.19 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.12 allows a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

5 repos

https://github.com/robomusk52/exp-cmd-add-admin-vpn-CVE-2024-55591

https://github.com/amfg145/Private-CVE-2024-55591.

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/fortios-auth-bypass-check-CVE-2024-55591

https://github.com/sysirq/fortios-auth-bypass-poc-CVE-2024-55591

https://github.com/sysirq/fortios-auth-bypass-exploit-CVE-2024-55591

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-20T16:40:03.000Z ##

Fortinet Zero-Day CVE-2024-55591 Exposed: Super-Admin Access Risk https://cyble.com/blog/cve-2024-55591-the-fortinet-flaw-putting-critical-systems-at-risk/ #Vulnerability #CVE202455591 #Fortinet

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-20T16:40:03.000Z ##

Fortinet Zero-Day CVE-2024-55591 Exposed: Super-Admin Access Risk https://cyble.com/blog/cve-2024-55591-the-fortinet-flaw-putting-critical-systems-at-risk/ #Vulnerability #CVE202455591 #Fortinet

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-16T16:13:48.983Z ##

Rapid7: Fortinet firewalls hit with new zero-day attack, older data leak
Rapid7 confirms that at least some of the leaked Fortinet FortiGate firewall data from Belsen Group originated from 2022 incidents, but currently will not attribute any CVE to the leaked data.

Based on Beaumont's analysis and observations from our own investigations, it’s likely that the data dump published by the threat actor contains primarily or entirely older data.

They also warn about CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability, a recently announced exploited zero-day. While they acknowledge Arctic Wolf's blog post and note overlaps with the IOC in Fortinet's security advisory, "our team has so far only noted connections consistent with scanning or reconnaissance activity and not exploitation." Rapid7 highlights five other historical FortiOS zero-days. No new indicators shared.

#fortinet #fortigate #fortios #fortiproxy #vulnerability #zeroday #CVE_2024_55591 #eitw #belsengroup #cybercrime #dataleak #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-15T14:17:58.526Z ##

Note that Fortinet's security advisory has Indicators of Compromise, of which 3 out of 5 IP addresses overlap with Arctic Wolf reporting from 10 January 2025: Console Chaos: A Campaign Targeting Publicly Exposed Management Interfaces on Fortinet FortiGate Firewalls.

While its use in a ransomware campaign hasn't been confirmed by Arctic Wolf, @GossiTheDog notes exploitation by a ransomware operator:

they have a copy of an exploit and are using it for initial access and handing off for lateral movement.

#CVE_2024_55591 #threatintel #ioc #fortinet #FortiProxy #fortios #zeroday #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation #cisakev #kev #cti #cyberthreatintelligence #infosec

##
threatcodex at 2025-01-14T20:21:02.972Z ##

Console Chaos: A Campaign Targeting Publicly Exposed Management Interfaces on Fortinet FortiGate Firewalls
#CVE_2024_55591
https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog/console-chaos-targets-fortinet-fortigate-firewalls/

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T14:26:32.927Z ##

Happy #ZeroDay from your friends at Fortinet: Authentication bypass in Node.js websocket module
CVE-2024-55591 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical) An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS and FortiProxy may allow a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

Please note that reports show this is being exploited in the wild.

Indicators of compromise include possible log entries, IP addresses used, and admin accounts created. cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann @cR0w @briankrebs

#zeroday #patchtuesday #fortinet #vulnerability #CVE_2024_55591 #infosec #ioc #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #fortios #fortiproxy

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T16:13:48.000Z ##

Rapid7: Fortinet firewalls hit with new zero-day attack, older data leak
Rapid7 confirms that at least some of the leaked Fortinet FortiGate firewall data from Belsen Group originated from 2022 incidents, but currently will not attribute any CVE to the leaked data.

Based on Beaumont's analysis and observations from our own investigations, it’s likely that the data dump published by the threat actor contains primarily or entirely older data.

They also warn about CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability, a recently announced exploited zero-day. While they acknowledge Arctic Wolf's blog post and note overlaps with the IOC in Fortinet's security advisory, "our team has so far only noted connections consistent with scanning or reconnaissance activity and not exploitation." Rapid7 highlights five other historical FortiOS zero-days. No new indicators shared.

CVE-2024-55591 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical) An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS and FortiProxy may allow a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-16T16:13:48.983Z ##

Rapid7: Fortinet firewalls hit with new zero-day attack, older data leak
Rapid7 confirms that at least some of the leaked Fortinet FortiGate firewall data from Belsen Group originated from 2022 incidents, but currently will not attribute any CVE to the leaked data.

Based on Beaumont's analysis and observations from our own investigations, it’s likely that the data dump published by the threat actor contains primarily or entirely older data.

They also warn about CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability, a recently announced exploited zero-day. While they acknowledge Arctic Wolf's blog post and note overlaps with the IOC in Fortinet's security advisory, "our team has so far only noted connections consistent with scanning or reconnaissance activity and not exploitation." Rapid7 highlights five other historical FortiOS zero-days. No new indicators shared.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-15T14:17:58.000Z ##

Note that Fortinet's security advisory has Indicators of Compromise, of which 3 out of 5 IP addresses overlap with Arctic Wolf reporting from 10 January 2025: Console Chaos: A Campaign Targeting Publicly Exposed Management Interfaces on Fortinet FortiGate Firewalls.

While its use in a ransomware campaign hasn't been confirmed by Arctic Wolf, @GossiTheDog notes exploitation by a ransomware operator:

they have a copy of an exploit and are using it for initial access and handing off for lateral movement.

#CVE_2024_55591 #threatintel #ioc #fortinet #FortiProxy #fortios #zeroday #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation #cisakev #kev #cti #cyberthreatintelligence #infosec

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T14:26:32.000Z ##

Happy #ZeroDay from your friends at Fortinet: Authentication bypass in Node.js websocket module
CVE-2024-55591 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical) An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS and FortiProxy may allow a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

Please note that reports show this is being exploited in the wild.

Indicators of compromise include possible log entries, IP addresses used, and admin accounts created. cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann @cR0w @briankrebs

#zeroday #patchtuesday #fortinet #vulnerability #CVE_2024_55591 #infosec #ioc #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #fortios #fortiproxy

##
jbhall56 at 2025-01-22T13:11:20.236Z ##

Data from the Shadowserver Foundation shows 48,457 Fortinet boxes are still publicly exposed and haven't had the patch for CVE-2024-55591 applied, despite stark warnings issued over the past seven days. https://www.theregister.com/2025/01/21/fortinet_firewalls_still_vulnerable/

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T18:48:50.000Z ##

💡CVE-2024-55591; A Fortinet FortiOS Authentication Bypass Vulnerable Behaviour Detection

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/fortios-auth-bypass-check-CVE-2024-55591

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T17:22:03.000Z ##

Well this was a little time-consuming to untangle, but it's looking like the two different Fortinet firewall incidents this week are probably unrelated:

1. A new zero-day vulnerability in FortiOS (CVE-2024-55591) is being exploited in the wild and could allow attackers to gain super-admin access. Rapid7 has observed possible reconnaissance but no successful exploitation so far.
2. Separately, a threat actor published IP addresses, passwords, and config data from 15,000 FortiGate devices in a dark web post. The data appears to be from 2022. Rapid7 has not linked a CVE to the mass firewall data leak but has independently confirmed that at least part of that data came from 2022 breaches.

Huge thanks to @GossiTheDog for his super helpful analysis of the FortiDump and subsequent IR observations. It saved me some work hours that got put toward sleep, for which I am massively grateful :)

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/01/16/etr-fortinet-firewalls-hit-with-new-zero-day-attack-older-data-leak/

##
soc_prime@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T13:37:54.000Z ##

Detect CVE-2024-55591 exploitation attempts, a critical authentication bypass vulnerability in Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy exploited in the wild, with Sigma rules from SOC Prime.

https://socprime.com/blog/cve-2024-55591-exploits-detection/?utm_source=mastodon&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=latest-threats&utm_content=blog-post

#cybersecurity #infosecurity

##

CVE-2024-45478
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T21:31:59

2 posts

Stored XSS vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0. Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

cR0w at 2025-01-21T22:17:48.344Z ##

We've got some Apache CVEs today too. These are in Ranger and Ambari. None have been evaluated for CVSS scores or vectors yet.

CVE-2025-23195: https://lists.apache.org/thread/hsb6mvxd7g37dq1ygtd0pd88gs9tfcwq

An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability exists in the Ambari/Oozie
project, allowing an attacker to inject malicious XML entities. This
vulnerability occurs due to insecure parsing of XML input using the
DocumentBuilderFactory class without disabling external entity
resolution. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary
files on the server or perform server-side request forgery (SSRF)
attacks. The issue has been fixed in both Ambari 2.7.9 and the trunk
branch.

CVE-2025-23196: https://lists.apache.org/thread/70g1l5lxvko7kvhyxmtmklhhfrlon837

A code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Alert Definition
feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute arbitrary
shell commands. The vulnerability arises when defining alert scripts,
where the script filename field is executed using sh -c. An attacker
with authenticated access can exploit this vulnerability to inject
malicious commands, leading to remote code execution on the server. The
issue has been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-51941: https://lists.apache.org/thread/xq50nlff7o7z1kq3y637clzzl6mjhl8j

A remote code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Metrics and
AMS Alerts feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute
arbitrary code. The vulnerability occurs when processing alert
definitions, where malicious input can be injected into the alert script
execution path. An attacker with authenticated access can exploit this
vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the server. The issue has
been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-45478: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

Stored XSS vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

CVE-2024-45479: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

SSRF vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-21T22:17:48.000Z ##

We've got some Apache CVEs today too. These are in Ranger and Ambari. None have been evaluated for CVSS scores or vectors yet.

CVE-2025-23195: https://lists.apache.org/thread/hsb6mvxd7g37dq1ygtd0pd88gs9tfcwq

An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability exists in the Ambari/Oozie
project, allowing an attacker to inject malicious XML entities. This
vulnerability occurs due to insecure parsing of XML input using the
DocumentBuilderFactory class without disabling external entity
resolution. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary
files on the server or perform server-side request forgery (SSRF)
attacks. The issue has been fixed in both Ambari 2.7.9 and the trunk
branch.

CVE-2025-23196: https://lists.apache.org/thread/70g1l5lxvko7kvhyxmtmklhhfrlon837

A code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Alert Definition
feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute arbitrary
shell commands. The vulnerability arises when defining alert scripts,
where the script filename field is executed using sh -c. An attacker
with authenticated access can exploit this vulnerability to inject
malicious commands, leading to remote code execution on the server. The
issue has been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-51941: https://lists.apache.org/thread/xq50nlff7o7z1kq3y637clzzl6mjhl8j

A remote code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Metrics and
AMS Alerts feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute
arbitrary code. The vulnerability occurs when processing alert
definitions, where malicious input can be injected into the alert script
execution path. An attacker with authenticated access can exploit this
vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the server. The issue has
been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-45478: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

Stored XSS vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

CVE-2024-45479: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

SSRF vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New version 132.0.6834.110/111 for Windows, Mac and 132.0.6834.110 for Linux includes 3 security fixes, 2 were externally reported. CVE-2025-0611 (high severity) Object corruption in V8 and CVE-2025-0612 (high) Out of bounds memory access in V8. No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2025-24402
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T19:31:58

2 posts

A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins Azure Service Fabric Plugin 1.6 and earlier allows attackers to connect to a Service Fabric URL using attacker-specified credentials IDs obtained through another method.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.681Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.000Z ##

  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

##

CVE-2025-24398
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T19:04:04

2 posts

An extension point in Jenkins allows selectively disabling cross-site request forgery (CSRF) protection for specific URLs. Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin implements this extension point to support OAuth 1.0 authentication. In Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin 2.1.0 through 4.1.3 (both inclusive) this implementation is too permissive, allowing attackers to craft URLs that would bypass the C

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.681Z ##

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

CVE-2025-20128
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-22T18:32:07

7 posts

A vulnerability in the Object Linking and Embedding 2 (OLE2) decryption routine of ClamAV could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to an integer underflow in a bounds check that allows for a heap buffer overflow read. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting a crafted file contai

cert_illicium@pouet.chapril.org at 2025-01-24T15:18:56.000Z ##

🔗 À lire ici : https://illicium.io/cert/bulletins/ICB-2025-1007

🔒 Vulnérabilités :

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-23T13:50:04.000Z ##

Cisco fixes ClamAV vulnerability with available PoC and critical Meeting Management flaw https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2025/01/23/cisco-clamav-cve-2025-20128-meeting-management-cve-2025-20156/ #videoconferencing #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Cisco #News #PoC

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T16:15:21.740Z ##

Cisco Zero-Day: ClamAV OLE2 File Format Decryption Denial of Service Vulnerability
CVE-2025-20128 (5.3 medium) A vulnerability in the Object Linking and Embedding 2 (OLE2) decryption routine of ClamAV could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to an integer underflow in a bounds check that allows for a heap buffer overflow read.

The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

Two more Cisco security advisories:

  • Cisco Meeting Management REST API Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2025-20156 (9.9 critical)
  • Cisco BroadWorks SIP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2025-20165 (7.5 high)

These two do not mention proof of concept or exploitation.

#cisco #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-23T13:50:04.000Z ##

Cisco fixes ClamAV vulnerability with available PoC and critical Meeting Management flaw https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2025/01/23/cisco-clamav-cve-2025-20128-meeting-management-cve-2025-20156/ #videoconferencing #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Cisco #News #PoC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T16:15:21.000Z ##

Cisco Zero-Day: ClamAV OLE2 File Format Decryption Denial of Service Vulnerability
CVE-2025-20128 (5.3 medium) A vulnerability in the Object Linking and Embedding 2 (OLE2) decryption routine of ClamAV could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to an integer underflow in a bounds check that allows for a heap buffer overflow read.

The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

Two more Cisco security advisories:

  • Cisco Meeting Management REST API Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2025-20156 (9.9 critical)
  • Cisco BroadWorks SIP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2025-20165 (7.5 high)

These two do not mention proof of concept or exploitation.

#cisco #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2025-20165
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-22T18:32:07

2 posts

A vulnerability in the SIP processing subsystem of Cisco BroadWorks could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to halt the processing of incoming SIP requests, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition. This vulnerability is due to improper memory handling for certain SIP requests. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a high number of SIP requests to an affected sys

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T16:15:21.740Z ##

Cisco Zero-Day: ClamAV OLE2 File Format Decryption Denial of Service Vulnerability
CVE-2025-20128 (5.3 medium) A vulnerability in the Object Linking and Embedding 2 (OLE2) decryption routine of ClamAV could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to an integer underflow in a bounds check that allows for a heap buffer overflow read.

The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

Two more Cisco security advisories:

  • Cisco Meeting Management REST API Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2025-20156 (9.9 critical)
  • Cisco BroadWorks SIP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2025-20165 (7.5 high)

These two do not mention proof of concept or exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-42012(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T18:31:56

1 posts

GRAU DATA Blocky before 3.1 stores passwords encrypted rather than hashed. At the login screen, the user's password is compared to the user's decrypted cleartext password. An attacker with Windows admin or debugging rights can therefore steal the user's Blocky password and from there impersonate that local user.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-22T16:30:24.000Z ##

CVE-2024-42012 – GRau DATA Password Disclosure

CVE ID : CVE-2024-42012 Published : Jan. 22, 2025, 4:15 p.m. | 14 minutes ago Description : GRAU DATA Blocky before 3.1 stores passwords encrypted rather than hashed. At the login screen, the user's password is compared to the user's decrypted cleartext password. An attacker with Windows admin or debugging rights can therefore steal the user's Blocky password and from there impersonate that local user. Severity: 0.0 | NA Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-42012-grau-data-password-disclosure/4726/

CVE-2024-42013(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T18:31:56

1 posts

In GRAU DATA Blocky before 3.1, Blocky-Gui has a Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security vulnerability. An attacker with Windows administrative or debugging privileges can patch a binary in memory or on disk to bypass the password login requirement and gain full access to all functions of the program.

CVE-2025-0604
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T18:18:26

2 posts

A flaw was found in Keycloak. When an Active Directory user resets their password, the system updates it without performing an LDAP bind to validate the new credentials against AD. This vulnerability allows users whose AD accounts are expired or disabled to regain access in Keycloak, bypassing AD restrictions. The issue enables authentication bypass and could allow unauthorized access under certai

cR0w at 2025-01-22T17:49:38.758Z ##

This looks like it could be a good post-exploitation CVE to keep in your back pocket:

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-0604

A flaw was found in Keycloak. When an Active Directory user resets their password, the system updates it without performing an LDAP bind to validate the new credentials against AD. This vulnerability allows users whose AD accounts are expired or disabled to regain access in Keycloak, bypassing AD restrictions. The issue enables authentication bypass and could allow unauthorized access under certain conditions.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T17:49:38.000Z ##

This looks like it could be a good post-exploitation CVE to keep in your back pocket:

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-0604

A flaw was found in Keycloak. When an Active Directory user resets their password, the system updates it without performing an LDAP bind to validate the new credentials against AD. This vulnerability allows users whose AD accounts are expired or disabled to regain access in Keycloak, bypassing AD restrictions. The issue enables authentication bypass and could allow unauthorized access under certain conditions.

This can not be exploited in a fresh install of PrestaShop, only shops made vulnerable by third party modules are concerned. (9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2025-01-22T17:15:12.800000

14 posts

A vulnerability in the REST API of Cisco Meeting Management could allow a remote, authenticated attacker with low privileges to elevate privileges to administrator on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because proper authorization is not enforced upon&nbsp;REST API users. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending API requests to a specific endpoint. A successful exploit

Cisco Zero-Day: ClamAV OLE2 File Format Decryption Denial of Service Vulnerability
CVE-2025-20128 (5.3 medium) A vulnerability in the Object Linking and Embedding 2 (OLE2) decryption routine of ClamAV could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to an integer underflow in a bounds check that allows for a heap buffer overflow read.

The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

Two more Cisco security advisories:

  • Cisco Meeting Management REST API Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2025-20156 (9.9 critical)
  • Cisco BroadWorks SIP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2025-20165 (7.5 high)

These two do not mention proof of concept or exploitation.

CVE-2025-0638
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T16:15:29.977000

5 posts

The initial code parsing the manifest did not check the content of the file names yet later code assumed that it was checked and panicked when encountering illegal characters, resulting in a crash of Routinator.

CVE-2025-0638 – Routinator Manifest File Name Content Inconsistency Crash

CVE ID : CVE-2025-0638 Published : Jan. 22, 2025, 4:15 p.m. | 14 minutes ago Description : The initial code parsing the manifest did not check the content of the file names yet later code assumed that it was checked and panicked when encountering illegal characters, resulting in a crash of Routinator. Severity: 7.5 | HIGH Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and more... Go to Source

##

CVE-2024-7344
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T15:41:04.577000

18 posts

Howyar UEFI Application "Reloader" (32-bit and 64-bit) is vulnerable to execution of unsigned software in a hardcoded path.

null_aleph@mastodon.social at 2025-01-20T09:02:06.000Z ##

https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/motherboards/new-uefi-vulnerability-bypasses-secure-boot-bootkits-stay-undetected-even-after-os-re-install

#CVE_2024_7344 #Howyar Taiwan #SecureBoot Bypass

#sysreturn #UEFI #XOR #Greenware #Greenguard #Radix #smartrecovery #sanfongez #WASAY #cesneoimpact #signalcomputer
#hddking

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T14:46:25.324Z ##

ESET Research: Under the cloak of UEFI Secure Boot: Introducing CVE-2024-7344
ESET discovered a vulnerability that allows bypassing Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. CVE-2024-7344 (6.5 medium) is in a UEFI app signed by Microsoft's 3rd-party UEFI certificate. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading (Portable Executable (PE)/Common Object File Format (COFF)) mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary (even unsigned) UEFI applications. The vulnerability is now fixed, and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update.

#vulnerability #UEFI #CVE_2024_7344 #infosec #cybersecurity #microsoft

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T14:46:25.000Z ##

ESET Research: Under the cloak of UEFI Secure Boot: Introducing CVE-2024-7344
ESET discovered a vulnerability that allows bypassing Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. CVE-2024-7344 (6.5 medium) is in a UEFI app signed by Microsoft's 3rd-party UEFI certificate. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading (Portable Executable (PE)/Common Object File Format (COFF)) mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary (even unsigned) UEFI applications. The vulnerability is now fixed, and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update.

#vulnerability #UEFI #CVE_2024_7344 #infosec #cybersecurity #microsoft

lavxnews@mastodon.cloud at 2025-01-16T15:22:53.000Z ##

Critical UEFI Secure Boot Flaw Exposes Systems to Bootkit Attacks

A newly discovered vulnerability in UEFI Secure Boot, tracked as CVE-2024-7344, poses a significant risk by allowing attackers to deploy bootkits even when Secure Boot is enabled. This article delves ...

https://news.lavx.hu/article/critical-uefi-secure-boot-flaw-exposes-systems-to-bootkit-attacks

screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T14:46:25.324Z ##

ESET Research: Under the cloak of UEFI Secure Boot: Introducing CVE-2024-7344
ESET discovered a vulnerability that allows bypassing Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. CVE-2024-7344 (6.5 medium) is in a UEFI app signed by Microsoft's 3rd-party UEFI certificate. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading (Portable Executable (PE)/Common Object File Format (COFF)) mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary (even unsigned) UEFI applications. The vulnerability is now fixed, and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update.

#vulnerability #UEFI #CVE_2024_7344 #infosec #cybersecurity #microsoft

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T14:46:25.000Z ##

ESET Research: Under the cloak of UEFI Secure Boot: Introducing CVE-2024-7344
ESET discovered a vulnerability that allows bypassing Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. CVE-2024-7344 (6.5 medium) is in a UEFI app signed by Microsoft's 3rd-party UEFI certificate. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading (Portable Executable (PE)/Common Object File Format (COFF)) mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary (even unsigned) UEFI applications. The vulnerability is now fixed, and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update.

#vulnerability #UEFI #CVE_2024_7344 #infosec #cybersecurity #microsoft

##
crft@mastodon.social at 2025-01-25T00:06:29.000Z ##

To deal with the #UEFI #Firmware #Exploit in cve-2024-7344. On #AlpineLinux you can run: apk add fwupd; fwupdmgr refresh; fwupdmgr update

##
maniabel@mastodon.de at 2025-01-16T21:32:42.000Z ##

Und was ist mit Linux?
Mit dem Patchday am Dienstag behob Microsoft die Sicherheitslücke CVE-2024-7344, die es Angreifer:innen mit bereits erlangtem privilegierten Zugriff auf ein Gerät ermöglichte, während des Bootvorgangs bösartige Firmware auszuführen.
ArsTechnica stellt fest, dass der Status für Linux-Geräte mit UEFI unklar sei.
https://arstechnica.com/security/2025/01/microsoft-patches-windows-to-eliminate-secure-boot-bypass-threat/

Prüfen, ob das "eigene" UEFI betroffen ist: https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/under-cloak-uefi-secure-boot-introducing-cve-2024-7344/
#Microsoft #UEFI #Linux

##

A new UEFI Secure Boot bypass vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-7344 that affects a Microsoft-signed application could be exploited to deploy...

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T13:01:34.000Z ##

The vulnerability, assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-7344 (CVSS score: 6.7), resides in a UEFI application signed by Microsoft's "Microsoft Corporation UEFI CA 2011" third-party UEFI certificate, according to a new report from ESET. https://thehackernews.com/2025/01/new-uefi-secure-boot-vulnerability.html

##

CVE-2024-51941
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T15:33:39

2 posts

A remote code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Metrics and AMS Alerts feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute arbitrary code. The vulnerability occurs when processing alert definitions, where malicious input can be injected into the alert script execution path. An attacker with authenticated access can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on

cR0w at 2025-01-21T22:17:48.344Z ##

We've got some Apache CVEs today too. These are in Ranger and Ambari. None have been evaluated for CVSS scores or vectors yet.

CVE-2025-23195: https://lists.apache.org/thread/hsb6mvxd7g37dq1ygtd0pd88gs9tfcwq

An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability exists in the Ambari/Oozie
project, allowing an attacker to inject malicious XML entities. This
vulnerability occurs due to insecure parsing of XML input using the
DocumentBuilderFactory class without disabling external entity
resolution. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary
files on the server or perform server-side request forgery (SSRF)
attacks. The issue has been fixed in both Ambari 2.7.9 and the trunk
branch.

CVE-2025-23196: https://lists.apache.org/thread/70g1l5lxvko7kvhyxmtmklhhfrlon837

A code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Alert Definition
feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute arbitrary
shell commands. The vulnerability arises when defining alert scripts,
where the script filename field is executed using sh -c. An attacker
with authenticated access can exploit this vulnerability to inject
malicious commands, leading to remote code execution on the server. The
issue has been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-51941: https://lists.apache.org/thread/xq50nlff7o7z1kq3y637clzzl6mjhl8j

A remote code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Metrics and
AMS Alerts feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute
arbitrary code. The vulnerability occurs when processing alert
definitions, where malicious input can be injected into the alert script
execution path. An attacker with authenticated access can exploit this
vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the server. The issue has
been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-45478: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

Stored XSS vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

CVE-2024-45479: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

SSRF vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-21T22:17:48.000Z ##

We've got some Apache CVEs today too. These are in Ranger and Ambari. None have been evaluated for CVSS scores or vectors yet.

CVE-2025-23195: https://lists.apache.org/thread/hsb6mvxd7g37dq1ygtd0pd88gs9tfcwq

An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability exists in the Ambari/Oozie
project, allowing an attacker to inject malicious XML entities. This
vulnerability occurs due to insecure parsing of XML input using the
DocumentBuilderFactory class without disabling external entity
resolution. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary
files on the server or perform server-side request forgery (SSRF)
attacks. The issue has been fixed in both Ambari 2.7.9 and the trunk
branch.

CVE-2025-23196: https://lists.apache.org/thread/70g1l5lxvko7kvhyxmtmklhhfrlon837

A code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Alert Definition
feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute arbitrary
shell commands. The vulnerability arises when defining alert scripts,
where the script filename field is executed using sh -c. An attacker
with authenticated access can exploit this vulnerability to inject
malicious commands, leading to remote code execution on the server. The
issue has been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-51941: https://lists.apache.org/thread/xq50nlff7o7z1kq3y637clzzl6mjhl8j

A remote code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Metrics and
AMS Alerts feature, allowing authenticated users to inject and execute
arbitrary code. The vulnerability occurs when processing alert
definitions, where malicious input can be injected into the alert script
execution path. An attacker with authenticated access can exploit this
vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the server. The issue has
been fixed in the latest versions of Ambari.

CVE-2024-45478: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

Stored XSS vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

CVE-2024-45479: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/RANGER/Vulnerabilities+found+in+Ranger

SSRF vulnerability in Edit Service Page of Apache Ranger UI in Apache Ranger Version 2.4.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version Apache Ranger 2.5.0, which fixes this issue.

An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability exists in the Ambari/Oozie
project, allowing an attacker to inject malicious XML entities. This
vulnerability occurs due to insecure parsing of XML input using the

where the script filename field is executed using sh -c. An attacker

A remote code injection vulnerability exists in the Ambari Metrics and

arbitrary code. The vulnerability occurs when processing alert

CVE-2025-23959
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T15:32:47

1 posts

Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Linus Lundahl Good Old Gallery allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects Good Old Gallery: from n/a through 2.1.2.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-22T16:30:18.000Z ##

CVE-2025-23959 – Good Old Gallery Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-23959 Published : Jan. 22, 2025, 3:15 p.m. | 1 hour, 14 minutes ago Description : Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Linus Lundahl Good Old Gallery allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects Good Old Gallery: from n/a through 2.1.2. Severity: 7.1 | HIGH Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and more... Go to Source

CVE-2025-23944
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T15:32:46

1 posts

Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability in WOOEXIM.COM WOOEXIM allows Object Injection. This issue affects WOOEXIM: from n/a through 5.0.0.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-22T16:30:13.000Z ##

CVE-2025-23944 – WOOEXIM.COM WOOEXIM Object Injection Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-23944

Published : Jan. 22, 2025, 3:15 p.m. | 1 hour, 14 minutes ago

CVE-2022-23439

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T10:15:07.737000

A externally controlled reference to a resource in another sphere in Fortinet FortiManager before version 7.4.3, FortiMail before version 7.0.3, FortiAnalyzer before version 7.4.3, FortiVoice version 7.0.0, 7.0.1 and before 6.4.8, FortiProxy before version 7.0.4, FortiRecorder version 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 and before 6.0.10, FortiAuthenticator version 6.4.0 through 6.4.1 and before 6.3.3, FortiNDR v

cR0w at 2025-01-22T13:30:41.463Z ##

Oh Fortinet. There is a CVE published today ( with a 2022 ID ) but the advisory link in the CVE is broken. Has it not been posted yet or was it a typo? That's something for someone else to care about until I get more coffee.

https://fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-21-254

A externally controlled reference to a resource in another sphere in Fortinet FortiManager before version 7.4.3, FortiMail before version 7.0.3, FortiAnalyzer before version 7.4.3, FortiVoice version 7.0.0, 7.0.1 and before 6.4.8, FortiProxy before version 7.0.4, FortiRecorder version 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 and before 6.0.10, FortiAuthenticator version 6.4.0 through 6.4.1 and before 6.3.3, FortiNDR version 7.2.0 before 7.1.0, FortiWLC before version 8.6.4, FortiPortal before version 6.0.9, FortiOS version 7.2.0 and before 7.0.5, FortiADC version 7.0.0 through 7.0.1 and before 6.2.3 , FortiDDoS before version 5.5.1, FortiDDoS-F before version 6.3.3, FortiTester before version 7.2.1, FortiSOAR before version 7.2.2 and FortiSwitch before version 6.3.3 allows attacker to poison web caches via crafted HTTP requests, where the Host header points to an arbitrary webserver

It's currently listed as sev:MED 4.7 CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N but we'll see if it's yet another sandbagged advisory that gets reevaluated later.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-23439
