##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T03:19:01.000Z ##

Fortinet: Analysis of Threat Actor Data Posting
Best hearing it from the vendor themselves when it comes to attributing a vulnerability in their own product: Fortinet corroborates @GossiTheDog's assessment (see parent toots above) that CVE-2022-40684 (9.8 critical) Fortinet Authentication Bypass Vulnerability was leveraged in order to obtain the stolen data. They also found evidence of CVE-2018-13379 (9.8 critical) FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability exploitation based on the data in password.txt.

  • The threat actor has leaked data obtained in dated campaigns that has been aggregated to appear like a new disclosure. Our analysis of the devices in question show that the majority have long since upgraded to newer versions.
  • We can also confirm that devices purchased since December 2022 or devices which have only run FortiOS 7.2.2 or above are not impacted by the information disclosed by this threat actor.
  • Whilst this data is several years old and the IP addresses have been observed to no longer be relevant in many cases, we will be reaching out to any customers, where identified, to recommend to review configurations.

#fortinet #fortigate #fortios #vulnerability #CVE_2018_13379 #CVE_2022_40684 #BelsenGroup #cybercrime #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #CVE #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T14:24:20.000Z ##

Double Pulsar: 2022 zero day was used to raid Fortigate firewall configs. Somebody just released them.
FortiGate firewall logs stolen during a mass exploitation of CVE-2022-40684 years ago appears to have been publicly released yesterday by a new threat actor called Belsen Group. @GossiTheDog verified the authenticity of the data for at least one victim organization and dated the logs and exploitation timeframe to October 2022. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Hackers leak configs and VPN credentials for 15,000 FortiGate devices

#threatintel #CVE_2022_40684 #fortinet #fortigate #vulnerability #eitw #BelsenGroup #cybercrime #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-16T01:05:00.000Z ##

One final update - did some IR on an impacted device, it looks like CVE-2022-40684 based on artefacts left behind.

It also looks like the data was assembled in October 2022 and only just released, looking back at historic IP records vs the dump. So basically if your config might be in the dump even if you patched, as it was a zero day at the time.

Also in the dump is complete firewall rules for the devices.

##

CVE-2017-17215
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 27.98%

updated 2023-02-02T05:08:25

6 posts

Huawei HG532 with some customized versions has a remote code execution vulnerability. An authenticated attacker could send malicious packets to port 37215 to launch attacks. Successful exploit could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

4 repos

https://github.com/kd992102/CVE-2017-17275

https://github.com/1337g/CVE-2017-17215

https://github.com/ltfafei/HuaWei_Route_HG532_RCE_CVE-2017-17215

https://github.com/wilfred-wulbou/HG532d-RCE-Exploit

screaminggoat at 2025-01-21T20:15:00.994Z ##

Qualys: Mass Campaign of Murdoc Botnet Mirai: A New Variant of Corona Mirai
A Mirai botnet variant dubbed " Murdoc Botnet" exploits vulnerabilities targeting AVTECH Cameras and Huawei HG532 routers. Qualys describes Murdoc Botnet's propagation methods and attack vectors. Indicators of compromise are provided.

h/t: @ntkramer. References:

  • CVE-2024-7029 (9.8 critical) AVTech AVM1203 command injection vulnerability, is an exploited zero-day previously identified by Akamai on 28 August 2024.
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 remote code execution vulnerability

#threatintel #mirai #murdocbotnet #botnet #avtech #vulnerability #eitw #huawei #infosec #IOC #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-7029, CVE-2017-17215

##

CVE-2024-9042
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

14 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2025-01-24T15:33:14.718Z ##

Akamai: Exploit Me, Baby, One More Time: Command Injection in Kubernetes Log Query
Akamai discloses vulnerability details for CVE-2024-9042, which they says allows for remote code execution with SYSTEM privileges on all Windows endpoints within a Kubernetes cluster. To exploit this vulnerability, the cluster must be configured to run the new logging mechanism "Log Query." The vulnerability can be triggered with a simple GET request to the remote node. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to full takeover on all Windows nodes in a cluster. Akamai provides a proof-of-concept curl command and discuss possible mitigations.

#kubernetes #vulnerability #CVE_2024_9042 #cve #proofofconcept #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-24T15:33:14.000Z ##

Akamai: Exploit Me, Baby, One More Time: Command Injection in Kubernetes Log Query
Akamai discloses vulnerability details for CVE-2024-9042, which they says allows for remote code execution with SYSTEM privileges on all Windows endpoints within a Kubernetes cluster. To exploit this vulnerability, the cluster must be configured to run the new logging mechanism "Log Query." The vulnerability can be triggered with a simple GET request to the remote node. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to full takeover on all Windows nodes in a cluster. Akamai provides a proof-of-concept curl command and discuss possible mitigations.

#kubernetes #vulnerability #CVE_2024_9042 #cve #proofofconcept #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2025-22612 – Coolify Key Disclosure and Remote Command Execution Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22612 Published : Jan. 24, 2025, 5:15 p.m. | 13 hours, 3 minutes ago Description : Coolify is an open-source and self-hostable tool for managing servers, applications, and databases. Prior to version 4.0.0-beta.374, the missing authorization allows an authenticated user to retrieve any existing private keys on a coolify instance in plain text. If the server configuration of IP / domain, port (most likely 22) and user (root) matches with the victim's server […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-22612-coolify-key-disclosure-and-remote-command-execution-vulnerability/5017/

CVE-2025-22609

3 posts

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-25T07:43:46.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22609 – Coolify Remote Command Execution as Unprivileged User

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22609 Published : Jan. 24, 2025, 5:15 p.m. | 13 hours, 3 minutes ago Description : Coolify is an open-source and self-hostable tool for managing servers, applications, and databases. Prior to version 4.0.0-beta.361, the missing authorization allows any authenticated user to attach any existing private key on a coolify instance to his own server. If the server configuration of IP / domain, port (most likely 22) and user (root) matches with the victim's server […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-22609-coolify-remote-command-execution-as-unprivileged-user/5015/

##
cR0w at 2025-01-24T16:57:54.666Z ##

I don't know anything about Coolify, but here's a perfect 10 Private Key Hijacking / RCE vuln, partly because of the gender assumption in the description. Is that petty? Yes. But it's a perfect 10 anyway so go nuts.

https://github.com/coollabsio/coolify/security/advisories/GHSA-3w2c-jfr2-9pg9

The missing authorization allows any authenticated user to attach any existing private key on a coolify instance to his own server.
If the server configuration of IP / domain, port (most likely 22) and user (root) matches with the victim's server configuration, then the attacker can use the Terminal feature and execute arbitrary commands on the victim's server.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22609

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-24T16:57:54.000Z ##

The missing authorization allows any authenticated user to attach any existing private key on a coolify instance to his own server.
If the server configuration of IP / domain, port (most likely 22) and user (root) matches with the victim's server configuration, then the attacker can use the Terminal feature and execute arbitrary commands on the victim's server.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22609

CVE-2025-22611 – Coolify Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22611 Published : Jan. 24, 2025, 5:15 p.m. | 13 hours, 3 minutes ago Description : Coolify is an open-source and self-hostable tool for managing servers, applications, and databases. Prior to version 4.0.0-beta.361, the missing authorization allows any authenticated user to escalate his or any other team members privileges to any role, including the owner role. He's also able to kick every other member out of the team, including admins and owners. This allows the […]

CVE-2025-0142
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.681Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-22T17:54:35.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2025-01-22

  • CVE-2025-24397 (4.3 medium) Incorrect permission check in GitLab Plugin allows enumerating credentials IDs
  • CVE-2025-24398 (8.8 high) Bitbucket Server Integration Plugin allows bypassing CSRF protection for any URL
  • CVE-2025-24399 (8.8 high) Improper handling of case sensitivity in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2025-0142 (4.3 medium) Tokens stored in plain text by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE pending (3.1 low) Tokens displayed without masking by Zoom Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24400 (4.3 medium) Cache confusion in Eiffel Broadcaster Plugin
  • CVE-2025-24401 (6.8 medium) Disabled permissions can be granted by Folder-based Authorization Strategy Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
  • CVE-2025-24402 (CSRF) and CVE-2025-24403 (missing permission check) (4.3 medium) in Azure Service Fabric Plugin
    • As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.

@cR0w suggested that these should be patched, but there is no patch available for 3 vulnerabilities.

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2025-23039
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-01-17T21:25:26.755Z ##

LOL. LMAO.

https://github.com/caido/caido/security/advisories/GHSA-3mfw-fhfp-mgrv

Caido is a web security auditing toolkit. A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability was identified in Caido v0.45.0 due to improper sanitization in the URL decoding tooltip of HTTP request and response editors. This issue could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary scripts, potentially leading to the theft of sensitive information. This issue has been addressed in version 0.45.1 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23039

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T21:25:26.000Z ##

Caido is a web security auditing toolkit. This issue could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary scripts, potentially leading to the theft of sensitive information. This issue has been addressed in version 0.45.1 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

CVE-2025-23202
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-01-17T21:17:52.358Z ##

It's too bad Sanitize Thy Inputs didn't make the top ten, otherwise this perfect 10.0 🥳 could have been prevented:

https://github.com/devycreates/Bible-Module/security/advisories/GHSA-cm7w-99v2-prrq

Bible Module is a tool designed for ROBLOX developers to integrate Bible functionality into their games. The FetchVerse and FetchPassage functions in the Bible Module are susceptible to injection attacks due to the absence of input validation. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to manipulate the API request URLs, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data tampering. This issue has been addressed in version 0.0.3. All users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23202

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T21:17:52.000Z ##

It's too bad Sanitize Thy Inputs didn't make the top ten, otherwise this perfect 10.0 🥳 could have been prevented:

https://github.com/devycreates/Bible-Module/security/advisories/GHSA-cm7w-99v2-prrq

Bible Module is a tool designed for ROBLOX developers to integrate Bible functionality into their games. The FetchVerse and FetchPassage functions in the Bible Module are susceptible to injection attacks due to the absence of input validation. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to manipulate the API request URLs, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data tampering. This issue has been addressed in version 0.0.3. ##

CVE-2024-52005
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-15T18:31:31.000Z ##

Git sounding a bit snarky in CVE-2024-52005

When cloning from a server (or fetching, or pushing), informational or error messages are transported from the remote Git process to the client via the so-called "sideband channel". These messages will be prefixed with "remote:" and printed directly to the standard error output.

Typically, this standard error output is connected to a terminal that understands ANSI escape sequences, which Git did not protect against. Most modern terminals support control sequences that can be used by a malicious actor to hide and misrepresent information, or to mislead the user into executing untrusted scripts.

https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-7jjc-gg6m-3329

##

CVE-2025-0367
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-15T17:29:37.000Z ##

Splunk security advisory 15 January 2025: Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in Splunk Supporting Add-on for Active Directory (SA-ldapsearch)
CVE-2025-0367 (6.5 medium) In versions 3.1.0 and lower of the Splunk Supporting Add-on for Active Directory, also known as “SA-ldapsearch”, a vulnerable regular expression pattern could lead to a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attack.

No mention of exploitation

#splunk #vulnerability #CVE_2025_0367 #cve #infosec #cybersecurity
